description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

Google’s Chrome OS Partner Engineering team works closely with leading-edge chipset manufacturers and original equipment manufacturers (OEMs)/original device manufacturers (ODMs) in delivering innovative computing devices. We build crucial relationships with and technical solutions for our partners. We are driving toward a fast, secure and simple user experience for all Chrome devices.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 5 years of experience managing ODMs and component suppliers for component qualification processes.
  • 5 years of experience working closely with chipset and component vendors to qualify new components.
  • 5 years of experience in reviewing and approving component supplier qualification effort for various SoC platforms.
  • 5 years of experience working with Engineering and Project Management from Software and Hardware teams.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 5 years of experience managing complex, multi-group, multi-disciplinary projects.
  • 2 years of experience in technology-related project management.
responsibilities:
• Manage the Chrome device supply chain and contribute to our current product line (i.e., Chromebook, Chromebook convertible, Chromebox, Chromebase). Collaborate with teams throughout Google to develop supply chain for reference design and work with strategic partners around the globe.
  • Leverage a technical background and business judgment to understand our partners' needs, market trends and propose technical solutions for Engineering and Product teams to implement. Be responsible for technical integration that will require an understanding of technology and of the dynamics between users in the Computer and Electronics/Devices ecosystem.
  • Manage strategic Chrome OS component supplier partnerships across a range of component types (e.g., Touch, Display, Storage, Memory, Stylus, Accelerometer, Gyro) and ensure successful device design and technical integration. Manage ODMs and component suppliers for component qualification processes and work closely with chipset and component vendors to qualify new components and ensure successful integration with Chrome devices.
  • Work with partners to define hardware supply chain roadmap and device specifications, optimize implementations and integrations to drive new device business opportunities and manage the overall technical aspects to build successful, long-term partnerships.
  • Assist the Business Development on drafting vendor agreements and drive product and technical issues to resolution.
title: Technical Program Manager, Chrome OS, Hardware
